intro: Solidago virgaurea subsp. dahurica, commonly known as the Siberian goldenrod, is a herbaceous perennial native to northern regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It features upright, branching stems that bear clusters of small, bright yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration and pollinator support.
